alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Calhoun; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, Lexington, northeastern Aiken, northwestern Orangeburg and central Richland Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sandy Run, or 11 miles southwest of McEntire Air Base, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, McEntire Air Base, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Harbison State Forest, Sesquicentennial State Park, and SC State Fair Grounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 41 and 77. Interstate 26 between mile markers 103 and 133. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Calhoun; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland
